fields.description:
Current jiraissues macro supports Jira instances with public access and allows including statically defined user credentials into the Jira URL for restricted access Jiras.

I propose the following intermediate Jira / Confluence integration improvement into the macro:

1) Add a new "Trusted Jira addresses" preference into the Administration section which would allow the admin to list a set of trusted jira instances (ie, beginnings of the URL).

2) Enhance jiraissues so that if the Jira which is being linked to with the macro is in the list of trusted Jiras, the osuser=xxx&ospassword=yyy is automatically appended into the url, with the credentials of the current user.

The above enhancement combined with configuring Confluence to use Jira's user database would allow for much more extensive use of the macro as then the user credentials would be safe and users would only see the issues they have access to.
fields.summary: Better authentication method for jiraissues and jiraportlet macros
Remove superfluous "=true" from some macro parameters

fields.description:
When Confluence runs a quick search, it fails to catch any text which may have been auto-placed there by a macro. For example, if you use a macro as such
{motto}
which simply replaces {motto} with 
h1. It's All Good
and then do a quick search on Confluence for "It's All Good," the search will fail to find all instances of "It's All Good" which have been placed there by {motto}. This significantly damages the performance of the quick search capability. 

Also, I have noticed that when attempting to search within a certain powerpoint document for specified text, confluence fails to grab it. However, it seems to work fine on another powerpoint. The problem may be macro based as well. I'm going to post the powerpoint here and hopefully you guys can figure things out.

Best of luck!
-Devin Looijen

fields.description:
One problem with blog posts is that you can't easily edit the blog post title, unlike a normal Confluence page where you can rename the page. You have to remove the blog post, then create a new blog post with a different title, then as cut and past the contents of your old blog post to the new blog post.

Perhaps we could have a link under Blog Post Operations where we can rename the blog post title?
fields.summary: Rename news (blog posts)

fields.description:
There is a problem with using attachments with WebDAV.
Atfer attaching a file to page the file is stored correctly on the WebDAV server
but confluence does not show the link on the page.
(when using the filesystem for attachments everything is OK)

I'm using confluence 1.1.2 on a apache2+tomcat5 server. (mod_jk2)
the WebDAV repository is hosted on the same apache2

Using the server with other WebDAV-enabled toos like cadaver does not cause any problems so I assume confluence may have some problem. Cadaver can even get
the files confluence had stored on the server.
I have used the mod_dav & mod_dav_fs modules of apache2

I assume the problem is caused by the used WebDAV client libraries apache slide+http-client. I far as I know silde has a problem with http redirects to the same sever.

Because we are using confluence in production without WebDAV now I cannot attach a matching logfile. (sorry!) I know I should have saved the old one ;-)
fields.summary: WebDAV does not work on a single server configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1571].
  {panel}

Often I want to highlight a specific section of code within a {code} macro. But there is user specifyable coloring within {code}. Some brainstorming:

* Allow for {code:color=grey...} - This would turn off syntax highlighting.
* Within the macro allow for the use of {color} macro. 

Kinda klunky. Maybe this should not be added to {code}, but rather a sublcass of {code} or a new macro altogether so it could have clearer specification.

Does this make any sense?

In our case "äüö" work fine, however the trouble starts when there is an uppercase umlaut in the page name, e.g. "ÄÜÖ".

The children macro will however produce a link which is display to an non-existing page and when selected will try to create a page by that name.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1567].
  {panel}

We use conflucence for meeting notes, daily student assignement tasks lists, etc.

I end up copying a page text, to a new page, and saving it.

Other users were suggesting using the move feature, and then creating a new page with the same name.

It would be nice say, save this version of this page (add date to the page name), and lock the page. Basically, make a historic note of what the page said.

It might even be that these entries would be blogs, so that the blog features could be used.

fields.description:
If confluence is running at:

http://www.blah.com/confluence

Then the url in the wsdl is:

http://12.123.212/rpc/soap/confluenceservice-v1 

(Note the missing "/confluence")

-------
Also why is it the IP address of the box? 

When you do the glue publishing, you have to specify the base url from the confluence setup info...
You cant assume its the local machine address - because it could be behind a firewall or any other kind of NAT.

fields.description: The .tar.gz file of Confluence has been packaged so that the expanded directory name is just "confluence". If two versions of confluence are uncompressed in same directory, the later expansion overwrites the first. I'd prefer the Jira packaging where the expanded directory contains the version number of the expanded software. This would have the advantage of reducing risk of starting to install wrong version and also not accidentally expanding a new version straight over the old one (which I managed to do earlier :).
fields.summary: Packaged distribution should expand to confluence-version

fields.description:
In a corporate environment, its important to be able to cluster webapps so that:
a) it can be deployed on standard appserver farms (which are clustered)
b) we have redundancy and automatic failover.

If the application requires a cold standby (as is the case with Jira nd Confluence as they stand), its a major PITA.
Due to it support priorities to business-critical applications, a application that requires manual fail-over will have a downtime of anything from minutes to hours.

As I see it the issues are:

1) Hibernate Caching - can be taken care of at the hibernate level (known solutions: free and not free - customer can choose)
2) Indexing. If filesystem indexing is essential, then we need some kind of fault-tolerant index synchronisation mechanism. JMS?
3) confluence.cfg.xml Config file. Can this be pre-edited and deployed in the WAR?
4) default-formatting.properties Can this be pre-edited and deployed in the WAR?
5) Custom Velocity templates: Can these be stored in database or via webdav?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1531].
  {panel}

During setup, on the "Setup Datasource Connection" page, the "DataSource Name" field should actually be called "DataSource JNDI Name".

a) because that is what it is
b) because some appservers (webfear, weblogic, etc) have a notion of a "datasource name" (its JMX name actually) which is usually different from its JNDI name.

(Also, a jndi name doesnt usually start with "jdbc/" )
fields.summary: JNDI Name field on "Setup Datasource Connection" page should be called "DataSource JNDI Name"

fields.description:
When user management is delegated to JIRA, and the ANYONE group assigned global USE permissions, _all_ registered users in JIRA and Confluence are counted as licensed users. 

Hence under a jira+confluence shared user base scenario, all users in the system are counted whether they are using Confluence or not. This doesn't give the customer much control over their licenses. They are faced with a dilemma where they want to enable anonymous access but do not want to blow out their licenses.

Create a new Blog Post & enter the following as the first line of text :-

h3. TAG developer sessions - Today ! {anchor:TAG developer sessions - Today!}

Remove the hyphens and the text will correctly display.

If you wish I can send a SnipSnap export that will also produce the same.

fields.summary: Links with *checkout* don't work properly

fields.description:
page anchors are not rendered properly when Camel Case linking is enabled in admin screen.

I tried using {anchor:myanchor1} and then point to it in another section of the document using [#myanchor1]

when page id displayed {anchor:myanchor1} is rendered as partially garbled text in the page, and [#myanchor1] page does not take you anywhere (because the html anchor is not created properly).

I left the page as is but then turned Camel Case linking in Admin screen OFF. The anchor was then rendered properly (in html view source of the wiki page) and subsequently the link [#myanchor1] worked properly.
fields.summary: page anchor links break

fields.description:
One of the reasons Confluence was selected by our company was so that we could have various blogs about our business contained within the site, and that RSS feeds would be available for these blogs.  We have managed to achieve this, but at the cost of security.

In order to read an RSS feed from a space using an RSS aggregator like 'RSS Bandit', that space needs to give permissions to 'Anyone'.  Otherwise, the reader is unable to access the RSS feed.  One solution is for Confluence to accept HTTP authentication for RSS feeds so that we can keep proprietary blog information secure.

This is critical to company wide adoption of Confluence.
fields.summary: Login for reading RSS feeds

fields.description:
Printing from Internet Explorer 6.0 (on Win2k) with "print background images & colours" enabled gives the 1st page of every Confluence document a full-page grey background.

This appears to be a bug with IE's interpretation of the style sheet since printing from Opera 7 and Netscape 7.1 with background images and colours enabled behaves as expected.

fields.description:
this issue was first brought up in the mailing list but no response for a while so escalating it to the issue tracker.

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=96&threadID=5658&messageID=210358683#210358683

We just set up a test install of confluence 1.1, jdk 1.4.2, resin 3.0.8 and everything seems to be working fine except one annoying problem. Whenever we go to view a page (whether directly, via a link, or after editing a page) the system kicks us back to the login page. Logging in again allows us to view the page, but then the next viewed page puts us back to the login again. Obviously the system remembers us because it doesn't ask us for login when editing pages, doing admin tasks, adding comments, etc. Just when viewing a page.

> That is an odd problem indeed. We use the same login system
> throughout the application, so if it's failing on one
> particular page and not others that's very strange.

Ya, it is weird...

> Does it make a difference if you login with cookies or not?
> (ie click the 'Remember me' check box)

Doesn't seem to. I've tried it both ways.

> Do you have cookies turned on in your browser?

Yes. Tested it with IE6 and Firefox (mozilla). Cookies on.

> Does it fail when viewing other content entities? (ie user
> profiles or blog posts)

Places that can be viewed without relogins

Dashboard
Browse spaces
View recent blog posts
All admin pages
Edit my profile page
History

Places that are requiring login for each hit

View profile
View page (both for normal pages and blogs)
View space summary
fields.summary: Confluence forces login on every page view (Resin 3.0 incompatibility)

fields.description:
Currently, all links mapped to the /display/ servlet redirect to the login page.

This is because request.getRemoteUser() is null.

We think it is something to do with Resin 3.0.8 applying filters again on a forwarded request, and webwork or our filters not coping properly.

You can track this down in ConfluenceActionSupport.getRemoteUser().

Other versions of Resin (2.x) do not seem to be affected, nor does any other application server.
fields.summary: All '/display/' links redirect to login page for Resin 3.0.8

fields.description:
It seems that users who are not in the confluence-administrators group can do some things in the Administration area, which is probably not a good thing. 

Specifically, one user who is not a member of confluence-administrators:
  General Configuration - no access
  Look & Feel - no access
  Site Decorators - no access
  Shortcut Links - no access
  Global Templates - can see templates - I don't have any defined at the moment so don't know if they can do anything with them
  Mail Servers - can't edit but can send a test email
  Paths - can modify the backup path
  Manage Macros - no access

  Backup & Restore - no access
  Rebuild Search Index - no access
  Mail Queue - can view
  SnipSnap Import - no access
  License Details - no access
  System Information - no access

  Manage Users - no access
  Manage Groups - no access
  Global Permissions - no access


I think they should be prevented from doing anything.....
fields.summary: Non-administrator users can perfrom some admin tasks

fields.description:
WebDAV attachments are stored correctly in the repository (checked with cadaver) but are not shown in conflucence (after attaching).  
Apache2 is used as frontend for tomcat (mod_jk2) and also as WebDAV server (mod_dav, mod_dav_fs)
I assume threre is a problem with the used WebDav client-lib which is used in confluence (slide, http-client ?),  there are many of the following messages in the tomcat log:

"<time> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase processRedirectResponse
INFO: Redirect requested but followRedirects is disabled"

I think it should be possible to use a single server (especially if used only on the intranet)
fields.summary: WebDAV attachments do not work on a single server configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1503].
  {panel}

Several persons are working on the same side including me. 
In the daily diff report I only get the diff of the current version to current-1 version.
Changes between yesterday and current-1 version will not be reported in the daily diff-report.

Improvement: 
Option in daily Diff report with
- diff of current to current-1 version
- diff of current version to version yesterday, when daily report is generated (here i will get all changes on the side since me last diff report)

Regards 
Michael
fields.summary: Daily report should link to diffs for whole days changes, not just the last revision

fields.description:
During the last days, I have been reported (and experienced) a really scary effect:

User X logs in and sets "remember me". This works for a while.
When the user returns to CF after a longer time (the next day in my case) all edits are marked as being done by user Y.

Eeek!

By the way, are there means to configure a timeout for the persitent cookie? I would like it to last only for a limted time of inactivity, e.g. 2 hours.
fields.summary: "remember me" results in wrong user identity (after a while) - Eeek!

fields.summary: System Error when access a page

fields.description: If the ANYONE group is assigned GLOBAL USE PERMISSIONS, the getActiveUsers() retrieves _all_ users in the system, including all users present inside JIRA, if user management has been delegated to JIRA.
fields.summary: Wrong number of licensed users reported when anonymous access enabled

fields.description: Hi the rss feed doesnt tell me who updated the page,add this info in to the body would be great.
fields.summary: RSS feeds of updated pages do not say who updated the page

fields.description:
Would like the option to say

"search for blah, but only in these selected spaces"
fields.summary: Option to scope searching

fields.description:
We have aproximately 130+ spaces, and we'd like to organise them into folders and subfolders so that users can find which spaces that they would like.

We can kind of do this via a new space and a page of links, but it would be great to have this type of functionality built in.
fields.summary: Ability to have folders of spaces
View users in groups listed in group browser

fields.description:
When the customer was trying to access the homepage, they got the following exception:

com.atlassian.confluence.setup.SpringSessionInViewFilter.sessionFactory : true
- javax.servlet.error.exception : org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'scheduler' defined in resource [/WEB-INF/schedulingSubsystemContext.xml] of ServletContext: Initialization of bean failed; nested exception is org.quartz.ObjectAlreadyExistsException: Unable to store Trigger with name: 'backupTrigger' and group: 'DEFAULT', because one already exists with this identification.
- javax.servlet.error.message :
- javax.servlet.error.request_uri : /confluence/homepage.action
fields.summary: Quartz ObjectAlreadyExistsException exception on MS SQL Server

fields.description: The new auto-anchor headings feature is nifty, but now it adds a minor issue. Writing links like [#Header] render like #Header It sure would be nice if they rendered without the hash sign.
fields.summary: Convert bare anchor links to remove hash sign

fields.description:
Our installation is configured with a base URL of weirdname.valtech.de/confluence.
The short url of a page on the "page information" page however reads
dedus-web02:6080/confluence/x/Cq. 

So the short link URL generation ignores the configured URL and simply takes the real hostname. Whoops.
fields.summary: "short link" not respecting site URL

fields.description:
FYI, what follows was an internal email thread spawned upon discovering the new <div> tag that was added that maps a double-click anywhere on the page to take you to the edit page.

Don't know if it's easy to make this "disable-able" (other than through the action we already took) but at least you might appreciate the usability feedback.

----

Sadly very much hardcoded.  This has been quashed.  Maybe we should ask them to make this disableable in a future revision.

~/oc4j/j2ee/home/confluence/pages $ diff viewpage.vm viewpage.vm.orig 
Warning: missing newline at end of file viewpage.vm.orig
8a9
>             <div onDblClick="window.location='$req.contextPath/pages/editpage.action?pageId=$action.pageId'">
272c273
< </html>
---
> </html>

To: Ed Powell
Cc: Nick Sieger
Subject: Re: confluence -- now slower?

That'd be my guess, but I haven't looked.

Subject: Re: confluence -- now slower?

Well, *that's* annoying.  Buggered if I know how to turn it off, 
though.  Javascript in the page templates?

On Jul 2, 2004, at 5:32 PM, Sean Walbran wrote:

> Votes on disabling the new "double click takes you to edit-page" 
> functionality?  I'm going nuts trying to copy-paste (where using 
> double click to highlight a word or triple-click to highlight a line 
> is broken by the sudden change of page).
fields.summary: Double-click to edit page feature unintuitive
